NewMort3.details: NewMort3 is an automated field that refers to whether a patient died within 30 days of the indexed procedure OR within hospital (both prior to and after 30 days). The fields used for this are Mort30 and Dischar.

TP.details: TP = 1 is a code for isolated CABG procedures TP = 2 is for isolated valve procedures TP = 3 is a combination of CABG and valve procedures TP = 4 is for other procedures

PROCNO.details: Record the sequential number of cardiac operation(s) performed on this patient on the day of the index operation.

CVA_W.details: If the patient suffered a cerebrovascular accident (CVA), was it recent or remote?

CART.details: Does the result of a non-invasive/invasive carotid test indicate 50% or greater diameter stenosis

PVD.details: Does the patient have a history of PVD characterised by aneurysmal, chronic, or acute occlusion/narrowing of the arterial lumen of the aorta or extremities

LD.details: Does the patient have a chronic respiratory/lung disease which is characterised by any of following?

LD_T.details: Indicate the severity of the chronic lung/respiratory disease from the list below.

IE.details: Did the patient present with valvular disease of infectious aetiology

IE_T.details: Indicate if endocarditis is active or treated.

IMSRX.details: Was the patient on any form of immunosuppressive therapy within 30 days of the current surgery

MI.details: Has the patient been hospitalised at any time for a Myocardial Infarction (MI)

MI_W.details: Indicate the time period between onset of the last documented myocardial infarction and surgery

CCS.details: Indicate the patient’s highest Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS) classification

ANGRXG.details: Did the patient receive IV GTN to treat angina on the day of surgery?

ANGRXH.details: Did the patient receive IV Heparin to treat angina ≤12 hours prior to surgery?

ANGRXC.details: id the patient receive full dose Heparinoids to treat angina ≤24 hours prior to surgery?

CHF.details: Does the patient have a history of congestive heart failure (CHF) diagnosed by a physician

CHF_C.details: During the current admission, was the patient diagnosed with CHF or was the management of CHF changed due to deterioration in CHF

NYHA.details: Indicate the patient’s highest level of dyspnoea as classified by the New York Heart Association

SHOCK.details: Was the patient in cardiogenic shock at the time of procedure?

RESUS.details: Did the patient require either of the following within one hour of the start of the operative procedure? - CPR or treatment for shock

ARRT.details: Was there a clinically documented pre-operative arrhythmia present?

ARRT_A.details: Was the clinically documented arrhythmia an atrial fibrillation or flutter requiring treatment?

ARRT_AT.details: Indicate the type of atrial fibrillation/flutter

ARRT_H.details: Was the clinically documented arrhythmia a complete heart block (AV dissociation)?

ARRT_V.details: Was the clinically documented arrhythmia sustained or recurrent ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation requiring cardioversion and/or IV medication?

ARRT_O.details: Was the clinically documented arrhythmia an ‘other’ arrhythmia, i.e. not one documented in variables

PACE.details: Indicate whether a previous permanent pacemaker was placed any time prior to this surgical procedure.

MEDIN.details: Did the patient receive inotropes on the day of surgery for haemodynamic support

MEDNI.details: Did the patient receive IV nitrates on the day of surgery?

MEDAC.details: Did the patient receive warfarin/heparin/ low molecular weight heparinoid/thrombin inhibitors, and/or factor Xa inhibitors ≤ 24 hours prior to surgery?

MEDST.details: Did the patient receive systemic steroids within 24 hours of surgery?

MED_ASP.details: Did the patient take aspirin within seven days prior to surgery?

MED_ASP_W.details: Enter number of days since the time the last documented aspirin was taken.

MED_CLOP.details: Did the patient take thienopyridine within seven days prior to surgery?

MED_CLOP_W.details: Enter number of days since the last documented Thienopyridine therapy was taken.

MED_TICA.details: Did the patient take Ticagrelor within seven days prior to surgery?

MED_TICA_W.details: Enter number of days since the last documented Ticagrelor therapy was taken.

MED_AGG.details: Did the patient take Tirofiban or Eptifibatide (short-acting glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitor) within seven days prior to surgery?

MED_AGG_W.details: Enter number of days since the last documented Tirofiban or Eptifibatide taken.

MED_ABCI.details: Did the patient receive abciximab (long acting glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitor) within seven days prior to surgery?

MED_ABCI_W.details: Enter number of days since the last documented abciximab was received?

MED_OTH.details: Did the patient receive any other antiplatelet therapy (apart from those listed in variables 50.0-54.0) within seven days prior to surgery?

MED_OTH_W.details: Enter number of days since the last documented ‘other’ antiplatelet therapy was received?

POP.details: Does the patient have any history of previous cardiothoracic intervention (surgical or percutaneous) prior to the index operation (including prior procedures performed in the current admission)?

PCS.details: Has the patient had any previous cardiac surgery prior to the index operation? This includes prior procedures performed during the index admission.

PBYP.details: Record the number of cardiac surgical operations performed on this patient utilising cardiopulmonary bypass prior to the index operation.

PBH.details: Record the number of cardiac surgical operations performed on this patient without cardiopulmonary bypass prior to the index operation.

PTAVR.details: Was a transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR) procedure performed at any time prior to the index operation (including those performed in the current admission)?

PTCA.details: Was a transluminal coronary angioplasty/coronary atherectomy and/or coronary stent procedure performed at any time prior to the index operation (including prior procedures performed in the current admission)?

PTCA_ADM.details: Was a PTCA/stent procedure performed prior to the current admission (remote) or during the current admission (this admission)?

PTCA_H.details: Record the time interval between PTCA/atherectomy/stent and the current surgical procedure.

LAAO.details: Has the patient undergone occlusion of the atrial appendage prior to the index operation (including those in the current admission)

SVT.details: Has the patient undergone a percutaneous ablation procedure for any form of supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) or ventricular tachycardia prior to the index operation

CATH.details: Has the patient had cardiac catheterisation (angiography)?

CATH_W.details: Record the date of the most recent cardiac catheterisation.

EF_T.details: Did the patent have their left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) measured?

EF.details: Record the percentage of blood emptied from the left ventricle at the end of the contraction.

EF_EST.details: If nuclear scan, echocardiogram, or left ventriculogram did not yield a digital EF%, review the study and provide an estimate.

LMD.details: Does the patient have any stenosis that involves any part of the left main?

DISVES.details: Indicate the number of (the three) major coronary systems (LAD system, Circumflex system, Right Coronary system)

PROC.details: Indicate the status of the surgeon who performed the majority of the ‘specific’ part of the operation

STAT.details: Indicate the clinical status of the patient prior to entering the operating room from the table below

UOR.details: Indicate why the patient’s clinical status was ‘urgent’:

DTCATH.details: Did the patient require direct transfer to theatre for ongoing management as a result of a cardiac catheter lab event?

CCAB.details: Is the index operation a Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG)?

CVLV.details: Is the index operation a Valve Procedure

COTH.details: Is the index operation for a cardiac procedure that is not a CABG or Valve?

CT.details: Is the index operation for cardiac transplant?

CPT.details: Is the index operation for transplant of the heart and lungs?

OTHCON.details: Is the index operation for a congenital complication not otherwise specified?

PLVEL.details: Does the index operation include the insertion of a permanent LV Epicardial Lead?

AO.details: Is the index operation for an Aortic Procedure?

AOP.details: Indicate the aortic aetiology necessitating current procedure.

AODS_A.details: What was the timing (acuity) of the aortic dissection?

MIN.details: Was a non-standard (sternotomy or thoracotomy) incision used for the cardiac procedure (on- or off- pump)?

ROBOT.details: Was the procedure performed with the assistance of a robot (e.g. Da Vinci, AESOP)?

CPB.details: Did the index operation use cardiopulmonary bypass (i.e. was the operation performed on-pump)?

CPLEG.details: Was cardioplegia used in the index operation?

CPLEG_T.details: What type of cardioplegia was used?

CCT.details: Where the index operation was performed on-pump, indicate the total number of minutes the aorta was completely cross-clamped and the heart was ischaemic during bypass.

PERF.details: Where the index operation was performed on-pump, indicate the total number of minutes the patient was on cardiopulmonary bypass.

MINHT.details: What was the lowest haemoglobin recorded whilst the patient was on cardiopulmonary bypass?

IABP.details: Did the patient have an Intra-Aortic Balloon Pump (IABP) inserted at any point during the current admission?

IABP_W.details: Where an IABP was inserted, indicate time of earliest insertion

IABP_I.details: What was the PRIMARY reason for insertion of the IABP?

ECMO.details: Was the patient placed on Extra-Corporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) at any time during the current admission?

ECMO_W.details: Indicate the earliest use of ECMO in the current admission.

ECMO_I.details: Indicate the PRIMARY reason for use of ECMO.

VAD.details: Did the patient have a ventricular assist device (VAD) implanted at any point during the current admission?

VAD_W.details: Indicate the earliest insertion of VAD during the current admission.

VAD_I.details: Indicate the PRIMARY reason for inserting a VAD.

ANTIFIB.details: Was an antifibrinolytic agent used intra-operatively during the index operation?

RBC.details: Were allogeneic red blood cells (RBC) transfused during the intra-operative or post-operative period?

RBCUnit.details: Enter the total number of RBC units transfused.

NRBC.details: During the index admission, were blood products other than RBC (e.g. FFP and Platelets) transfused?

PlateUnit.details: Indicate the number of platelet units transfused.

CryoUnit.details: Indicate the number of Cryoprecipitate units used.

FFPUnit.details: Indicate the number of Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP) units used.

AICU_D.details: Record the date and time of admission to ICU from OR after surgery.

EXTU_D.details: Record the date and time of extubation after surgery.

DICU_D.details: Record the date and time of discharge from ICU.

REICU.details: During the index operation, was the patient readmitted to ICU following the initial discharge from ICU

REINT.details: During the index admission, was the patient was re-intubated after the initial extubation?

REINT_D.details: Record the date and time when the patient was re-intubated.

REEXT_D.details: Record the date and time when the patient was extubated following re-intubation.

DRAIN_4.details: Record the fluid loss (in millilitres) from the pericardial/mediastinal (intercostal catheter) drains in the first 4 hours post-operation.

PINT.details: Recorded as prolonged intubation if the intubation is greater than 24 hours.

ROVD.details: Did the patient return to theatre for valve dysfunction?

ROBL.details: Did the patient return to theatre for bleeding/tamponade?

ROSI.details: Did the patient return to theatre for infection of sternal bone muscle and/or mediastinum?

RDTI.details: Did the patient return to theatre for infection involving a thoracotomy or parasternal site?

ROPA.details: Did the patient return to theatre for insertion of pacemaker or AICD?

ROOC.details: Did the patient return to theatre for other cardiac reasons (excluding insertion of pacemaker or AICD)?

RONC.details: Did the patient return to theatre for other non-cardiac reasons?

NRF.details: Was there acute post-operative renal insufficiency

HAEMOFIL.details: Did the patient undergo acute institution of haemofiltration (or dialysis) as treatment for new renal failure?

POSTCR.details: Record the highest serum creatinine level recorded after surgery.

POMI.details: Was a peri-/post- operative myocardial infarction (MI) diagnosed

POCS.details: Did the patient suffer peri-/ post- operative cardiogenic shock?

POSTHG.details: Record the lowest haemoglobin recorded post-operatively.

CIUSE.details: Was an inotrope used to maintain cardiac output or SVR for longer than 4 hours post-operatively?

IULOWOUT.details: Were inotrope(s) used for low cardiac output syndrome longer than four hours post-operatively

IULowSVR.details: Was a vasopressor used for low systemic vascular resistance syndrome for longer than 4 hours post- operatively

NARRT.details: Did any new form of cardiac arrhythmia occur that required treatment?

HB.details: Did the patient develop new heart block requiring the implantation of a permanent pacemaker prior to discharge?

BA.details: Did the patient develop a new bradyarrhythmia not otherwise specified requiring the implantation of permanent pacemaker prior to discharge?

CA.details: Did the patient have a new cardiac arrest documented

AFIB.details: Was there a new onset of atrial fibrillation/flutter (AF) requiring treatment?

NARRTV.details: Did any new form of ventricular tachycardia (greater than 6 beat run) occur that required treatment?

CVA_P.details: Did the patient experience a stroke or new central neurologic deficit (persisting for >72 hours) peri- or post-operatively?

CVA_T.details: Did the patient experience a new transient central neurologic deficit that was resolved completely within 72 hours (TIA/RIND)?

COMA.details: Did the patient have post-operative coma of neurologic aetiology lasting at least 24 hours?

VENT_P.details: Was the patient on prolonged ventilation post-operatively for pulmonary insufficiency requiring ventilator support for a total period of longer than 24 hours?

PUEMB.details: Did the patient have a new pulmonary embolism diagnosed by study such as ventilation/perfusion (V/Q) scan or angiogram?

PUPNU.details: Was pneumonia diagnosed post-operatively by one of the following:

INFDS.details: Did the patient develop infection of sternal bone, muscle and/or mediastinum?

SWI.details: Did the patient develop an infection involving the skin and subcutaneous tissues of the incision occurring within 30-days post-operation?

DOWI.details: Did the patient develop an infection involving deep soft tissues

INFTH.details: Did the patient develop an infection involving a thoracotomy or parasternal site?

INFSP.details: Did the patient develop septicaemia defined by positive blood cultures

NAODS.details: Did dissection occur in any part of the aorta?

LISCH.details: Was there any evidence of limb ischaemia?

ACOAG.details: Did the patient develop any bleeding, haemorrhage, and/or embolic events related to anticoagulant therapy?

GIT.details: Did the patient develop any GIT complication post-operatively

MSF.details: Did the patient develop multi-system failure post-operatively?

DISCHAR.details: Indicate from the list the location where the patient was discharged to

MORT_D.details: Indicate the date of death if the patient:

MORT_L.details: Specify the location of patient mortality:

MORT_R.details: Indicate the PRIMARY cause of death, i.e. the first significant event which ultimately led to death.

MORT_SR.details: Specific cause of death. This applies only when PRIMARY cause of death is cardiac or infection.

WITHDRAW.details: Did the patient who was aware of the consequences of his/her actions, elect to withdraw treatment in circumstances where they would survive if treatment had continued.

READ.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from the date of surgery for ANY reason?

READAC.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery due to an anticoagulant complication

READAR.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for management of any arrhythmia?

READCHF.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for treatment of congestive heart failure (CHF)

READVD.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for valve dysfunction?

READPE.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for treatment of pericardial effusion?

READCT.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for cardiac tamponade?

READPLE.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for symptomatic pleural effusion?

READOTHC.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for treatment for an ‘other’ complication

READDSI.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for deep sternal wound infection?

READIC.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for a complication involving the saphenous vein, radial artery harvest, thoracotomy or non-sternotomy cardiac access incision?

READRC.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for pneumonia or other respiratory complication?

READMI.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery for myocardial infarction (MI), diagnosed according to the definition listed on pages (34-35) in this document?

READRA.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from the date of surgery for recurrent angina?

READOTHNC.details: Was the patient readmitted as an in-patient within 30 days from surgery due to reasons not related to cardiac surgery?
